## Welcome to Light-Field Imaging 101

This tutorial is inspired by the Light-Field Imaging Toolkit [@bolan2016light] implemented in MATLAB.

## Quick Visualization

Let's verify our environment works with a simple visualization:

```{python}
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Create a simple array
x = np.linspace(0, 10, 100)
y = np.sin(x)

# Simple plot
plt.figure(figsize=(8, 4))
plt.plot(x, y)
plt.title('A Simple Sine Wave')
plt.xlabel('x')
plt.ylabel('sin(x)')
plt.grid(True)
plt.show()
